alert.note: Alert for Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 20 at 10:36PM CDT until July 21 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Kansas, including the following county, Wallace. * WHEN...Until 500 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 934 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Many secondary roadways will be impacted overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sharon Springs, Weskan and Wallace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
